Successful authentication events for pri.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4672; Zeek conn.log
Successful authentication events for pri.Action: Identify all successful login events (Event ID 4624) and privilege assignments (Event ID 4672) on servers hosting information repositories (databases, collaboration platforms). Filter for privileged accounts (Domain Admins, Enterprise Admins, etc.). Analyze the frequency and timing of these privileged access events. Use descriptive statistics and correlation analysis to identify privileged logins that occur outside typical administrative maintenance windows or correlate with suspicious network activity identified in Zeek logs.

Network traffic patterns indicative of l.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections originating from known information repository systems or user endpoints accessing repositories. Calculate the total bytes transferred per session or host. Use statistical methods (e.g., IQR, percentiles, or time series analysis) to identify sessions/hosts with unusually large data transfers compared to baseline or typical activity, especially connections to external IP addresses.

Unusual volume or rate of document/page.Data: Zeek http.log; Zeek conn.log; Windows Event ID 4663
Unusual volume or rate of document/page.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for GET requests or large responses from identified information repository domains/IPs. Monitor Zeek conn.log for data transfer volumes associated with user-initiated connections to repositories. If applicable, monitor Windows Event ID 4663 on file share repositories. Aggregate activity by source user/IP. Use statistical methods (e.g., mean/median data volume or request rate, percentile analysis) to identify users exhibiting significantly higher access volumes or rates than their peers or their own historical baseline. Flag users exceeding thresholds for investigation.

Outbound network connections or data tra.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek dns.log; Zeek http.log; Windows Event ID 5156
Outbound network connections or data tra.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log, dns.log, and http.log for connections originating from information repository servers or endpoints to known domains/IPs associated with external cloud storage (e.g., Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, Mega) or file-sharing services. Monitor Windows Event ID 5156 on endpoints/servers for outbound connections to these services. Filter for connections with large data transfer volumes. Use frequency analysis and correlation analysis to identify repeated transfers or transfers occurring outside normal patterns, especially if associated with users exhibiting high repository access volumes.
